result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven A Dalton

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steven A Dalton in court.  Attorney Eric m Hailstock Mr appeared by video for Steven A Dalton.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court took judicial notice of 05CF3171. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Officer S. Suvaka. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed: Justice Point Supervision Report.

Defendant Steven A Dalton in court in person.  Attorney Eric m Hailstock Mr in court in person for Steven A Dalton.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defense Counsel is newly appointed and requests an adjournment. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Preliminary hearing on September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ERIC HAILSTOCK, signed and filed. 
Copy mailed to defendant and emailed to the defense counsel.

Defendant Steven A Dalton in court.  William R. F. Ackell for Jon J0sephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for an Indigency Hearing. Defendant appears prose. Court held colluquy with defendant regarding his income. 
Court passed the case and instructed defendant to contact SPD Office to determine eligibility for appointment of counsel.

Case recalled. Same appearances. 
Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation  
Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by the court.  
Defendant agreed to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expense paid by Milwaukee County. 
The court appointed Attorney Eric Hailstock   to represent defendant  at County expense  at the rate of $100.00 per hour.
Defendant repay the County at a rate of $45.00 Per Month. Repayment to begin 30 Days after the conclusion of the case.  
Defendant advised failure to pay will result in a Civil Judgment 
Clerk contacted Attorney Webb regarding appointment of counsel. 
Court ordered matter adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Steven A Dalton in court, appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status. Defendant inform the court that attorney Toran is unable to represent the defendant. The defendant is indigent. Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing. 
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Indigency hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Steven A Dalton in court with Attorney James Edgar Toran who appears as a friend of the court.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. The issue of counsel needs to be addressed; Attorney Toran has been retained to represent co-defendants. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Status in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 061221,
Payable Number: 1017540,
Receipt Number: 22RP026993,
Amount: $20.00
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

09:50 AM Defendant Steven A Dalton in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant Steven A Dalton in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Steven A Dalton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
